page.title: 01Llandovery-general guide.
page.content: {Llandovery}is situated in the upper reaches of the{Towy Valley}where the rivers Bran and Gwydderig converge.It is a small{historical market town}in a {rural}setting,serving the local {farming}communities.The{Central Wales {Railway}line runs through Llandovery. The A483 links with the A40 near the Railway station.There are three {schools}.The County Primary,the County High and the College (a private school).Llandovery has seven places of worship,three{churches}(one being Catholic) and four{chapels. Some light{industry}which has been developed include a wire brush factory,clothing factory and pet food supplies distribution centre at Church Bank Industrial Estate.These are in addition to the existing sawmills nearby.The area is now being developed as a{tourist}attraction.
